question: A file is a collection of ________ stored on a computer.
A file can be compared to a ________ in a library.
A file has a title, which is also known as the ________.
The format of a file is specified by its ________.
A file attribute that shows when a file was last modified is called ________.
File attributes store ________ about the file.
The property that determines who can read, write, or execute a file is called ________.
An example of a text file is ________.
An executable file usually has the extension ________.
A binary file stores data in a format that is ________ to humans.
